recipes.title: Original Chex Party Mix
recipes.description: The classic savory snack mix with Chex cereals, nuts, pretzels, and a buttery seasoned coating.

ingredients.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, mix cereals, nuts, pretzels and bagel chips; set aside.
In small microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. Stir in seasonings.
Pour seasoned butter over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.pan_size: large microwavable bowl or roasting pan
notes: Duplicate card found in collection (file 471)

ingredients_metric.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 2.5cm pieces

oven_directions.text: Put cereal mixture and seasoning mixture into ungreased roasting pan.
Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: The Original Chex Party Mix
recipes.description: The classic savory snack mix - variant from 2011 box printing.

ingredients.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, mix cereals, nuts, pretzels and bagel chips; set aside. In small microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. Stir in seasonings. Pour over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.pan_size: large microwavable bowl or roasting pan
notes: Recipe is not gluten free
This is a variant of the same recipe from a different box printing (2011)
recipes.variant_notes: Same recipe from different box printing (2011). Identical ingredients. Minor wording differences in instructions. Adds 'Recipe is not gluten free' note.

ingredients_metric.prep_note: or regular bagel chips, broken into 2.5cm pieces

oven_directions.text: Heat oven to 250°F (120°C). In ungreased large roasting pan, melt butter in oven. Stir in seasonings.
Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated.
Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: Baked Tortilla Chips
recipes.description: Crispy homemade tortilla chips with chili-lime seasoning, baked not fried.

ingredients.item: Shedd's Spread Country Crock Plus Calcium Spread

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In small bowl, blend all ingredients except tortillas.
Brush mixture on one side of each tortilla; sprinkle, if desired, with salt.
Cut each tortilla into 8 wedges.
On greased baking sheets, arrange tortilla wedges in a single layer.
Bake 8 minutes or until golden and crisp.
Serve warm or place on wire rack to cool. Store in airtight container.

recipes.title: Spiced Nuts
recipes.description: Savory roasted nuts with cumin, curry, cayenne, ginger, and cinnamon - perfect for gifts.

instructions.text: [Steps 1-2 cut off]
In a bowl, mix cumin, chili powder, curry powder, garlic salt, cayenne, ginger and cinnamon. Set aside.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over low heat. Add spice mixture and stir well. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes to mellow flavors.
Place nuts in a bowl. Scrape spice mixture onto nuts and toss well.
Spread nuts in one layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice.
Remove from oven. With a rubber spatula, toss nuts with any spices and oil on bottom of pan. If desired, sprinkle with coarse salt and a bit more garlic salt.
Let rest for 2 hours in a cool place. Store in airtight jars, or pack up as gifts.

notes: Beginning of recipe was cut off - spice quantities unknown
Great for holiday gift-giving
Typical spiced nuts bake at 300-350°F for 30-40 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.

flags: Temperature inferred from standard spiced nuts recipes (300-350°F typical)
Some ingredient quantities still missing from original scan

recipes.title: Honey Roasted Bridge Mix
recipes.description: Sweet and cinnamon-spiced honey-glazed mixed nuts, perfect for card parties.

instructions.text: Combine honey, butter and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in saucepan.
Bring mixture to boil and boil 2 minutes stirring constantly.
Pour honey mixture over nuts and mix until nuts are coated.
Spread on foil-lined cookie sheet or jelly roll pan.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) 10 to 15 minutes or until nuts are glazed and lightly brown.
Cool 20 to 30 minutes; remove from foil.
Combine sugar and remaining cinnamon; toss with glazed nuts to coat.

notes: Watch carefully - nuts can burn quickly once glazed

recipes.title: Beef Jerky
recipes.description: Homemade beef jerky marinated overnight and slow-dried in the oven.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and marinate in refrigerator for 12 hours.
Bake at 150°F (65°C) for 8 hours.

notes: Slice meat as thin as possible

recipes.title: Super Nuts
recipes.description: Glazed nuts with Drambuie liqueur and warm spices.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine nuts, sugar, liqueur, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg; stir well.
Pour mixture onto lightly buttered baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) 8 minutes, stirring often, until liquid almost evaporates.
Pour onto another lightly buttered baking sheet.
Separate with a fork; cool completely.

notes: Can substitute other liqueurs like Amaretto

recipes.title: The Original Chex Party Mix (Microwave)
recipes.description: The classic Chex Party Mix made easy in the microwave - a holiday favorite!

ingredients.item: garlic-flavor bite-size bagel chips or regular-size bagel chips

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted.
Stir in seasonings. Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes.
Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Reduced-Fat Recipe: To reduce the fat to 2 grams and the calories to 80 per serving, use 3 tablespoons margarine instead of 6 tablespoons butter, omit mixed nuts and use fat-free bagel chips.
For more summer recipes go to www.chex.com

recipes.title: Granola Chews
recipes.description: Chewy apricot-raisin granola treats - three cooking methods provided (oven, electric frypan, microwave).

instructions.text: OVEN: 22 minutes cooking time. Stir together oats, almonds, wheat germ and sesame seeds in bowl. Set aside.
Place brown sugar, butter, honey, water and salt in 3-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 7 minutes, or until butter melts and mixture is slightly thickened.
Pour brown sugar mixture over oat mixture. Stir until well blended. Pour into 15½x10½x1-inch jelly-roll pan.
Bake in 400-degree oven 15 minutes or until oats are lightly toasted, turning with spatula every 5 minutes.
Pour mixture back into jelly-roll pan, spreading mixture to edges of pan. Press mixture down slightly, using a spatula. Let stand 30 minutes.
Stir in apricots and raisins. Break into small pieces. Store in airtight container up to 1 week.

notes: ELECTRIC FRYPAN: Cook at 260°F, stirring constantly, 5 minutes until butter melts. Stir in oats, almonds, wheat germ, sesame seed. Cook, stirring frequently, 10 minutes.

MICROWAVE OVEN: 20 minutes. Combine brown sugar, butter, honey, water and salt in 3-quart glass bowl. Microwave on High 4 minutes. Stir. Microwave 4 minutes more. Stir in oats, almonds, wheat germ and sesame seed. Microwave on Medium (50%) 3 minutes. Stir. Microwave 9 minutes more.

recipes.title: No-Frills Granola Bars
recipes.description: Simple homemade granola bars with oats, almonds, sunflower seeds, and corn syrup.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients, add liquids and stir together.
Press mixture firmly into a greased 9-by-13 or 10-by-15 pan with spatula or waxed paper.
Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into bars while warm.
Once bars are cool, remove from pan and wrap individually. Store in cool, dry place for up to two weeks or in the refrigerator indefinitely.

notes: Coconut-Almond Bars variation: Add 1 1/2 cups coconut, increase almonds to 1 cup and vegetable oil to 3/4 cup
Any of the following may be added: dried fruits, chocolate chips, sesame seeds, chopped nuts of your choice

recipes.title: Granola Crunch Bars
recipes.description: Easy baked bars made from Granola Crunch cereal and eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
Combine Granola Crunch and eggs thoroughly.
Spread on greased cookie sheet, pressing into oblong shape about 6-by-8 and 1/4 inch thick. Press firmly.
Impress bars 1-1/2 inches wide and 2 inches long.
Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes, then break apart.
Cool completely, wrap and store in covered container.

notes: Uses Granola Crunch cereal as base

recipes.title: Chex Party Mix (Handwritten Variant)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card with 'my idea' additions
recipes.description: A personalized Chex party mix with suggested additions like celery salt. Includes both small batch and large batch versions.

ingredients.item: salted mixed nuts or small pretzel sticks

instructions.text: Melt oleo in skillet (electric). Stir in seasonings - blend well.
Add Chex and nuts or sticks, mix well until all coated.
Cover skillet, leaving lid slightly open. Heat at 250°F (120°C) for 15 minutes.
Stir every 5 minutes.
Cool on paper towels.
Note: May use large skillet on range top - 15 minutes.

notes: Large batch version: 36 cups cereal, 1 1/2 cups oil, 3/4 cup Worcestershire sauce, 9 tsp season salt, 3 tsp garlic powder, 3 tsp onion powder
The 'my idea' addition of celery salt is a personal variation

recipes.title: Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Classic homemade caramel corn baked low and slow for a crunchy coating.

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, butter, corn syrup, and salt.
Heat to boiling; boil 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add soda and vanilla; mix thoroughly.
Pour over popped corn in a large bowl; stir to coat.
Place in two jelly roll pans (15x10 inch each), or one large roasting pan.
Bake at 200°F (95°C) for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
When cool, place in covered containers.

recipes.pan_size: Two 15x10 inch jelly roll pans or one large roasting pan
notes: Low and slow baking creates the crunchy coating

recipes.title: Heart Smart Party Mix
recipes.description: A healthier version of party mix using reduced oil and featuring oat cereal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C).
Mix all cereals, pretzels, and peanuts together in a large roasting pan.
Whisk together oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne.
Pour oil mixture over cereal mixture and toss to coat.
Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.

notes: Lower oil than traditional party mix
Adjust cayenne to taste

recipes.title: Homemade Graham Crackers
recipes.description: Homemade graham crackers made with whole wheat flour, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.

instructions.text: Cream butter and brown sugar together.
Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon together.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with water.
Mix well and let stand 30 minutes.
Roll on floured board to 1/8 inch thick.
Cut into 2-inch squares and mark with fork if desired.
Bake on oiled cookie sheet at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes.

notes: Let dough rest for best rolling
Score with fork to resemble store-bought

recipes.title: Jan's Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Crunchy oven-baked caramel corn with a long bake time for extra crispness.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 200°F (95°C).
In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, corn syrup, butter, cream of tartar, and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring until mixture comes to a boil.
Boil for 5 minutes without stirring.
Remove from heat and stir in baking soda (mixture will foam).
Pour over popped corn in a large roasting pan and mix well to coat.
Bake at 200°F for 2 hours, stirring 2-3 times during baking.
Remove and spread on wax paper to cool. Break into pieces.

recipes.pan_size: large roasting pan or cookie sheet
notes: Long low-temperature bake creates extra crispy caramel corn
Stir during baking for even coating
recipes.variant_notes: Similar base recipe but uses 200°F for 2 hours instead of 250°F for 1 hour

recipes.title: Party Mix (4-Chex Variety)
recipes.description: Classic party mix using four varieties of Chex cereal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C).
Heat butter in large shallow roasting pan (about 15 x 10 x 2 inches) in oven until melted.
Remove from oven. Stir in seasoned salt and Worcestershire sauce.
Add all Chex cereals and nuts. Mix until all pieces are coated.
Bake in oven 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on absorbent paper to cool.

notes: Party Mix may be frozen, so make a double batch
Thaw at room temperature in container
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 903.jpeg
recipes.variant_notes: Uses 4 varieties of Chex instead of 3, includes Bran Chex

recipes.title: Pretzel Bake (Seasoned)
recipes.description: Olive oil and herb seasoned pretzels, slow-baked for extra crunch.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 100°F (or lowest setting).
Mix all seasonings together in a small bowl.
Pour olive oil over pretzels in a large bowl and mix well.
Add seasoning mixture by spoonfuls, sprinkling and shaking to coat evenly.
Spread on baking sheet.
Bake 1-2 hours at 100°F, stirring occasionally.

notes: Very low temperature for long bake time creates extra crispy pretzels
Temperature unusually low - may need 200°F for standard ovens

recipes.title: Beef Jerky
recipes.description: Homemade oven-dried beef jerky with a savory spice blend.

instructions.text: Slice round steak into thin strips (⅛-¼ inch thick), cutting against the grain.
Combine all marinade ingredients (Worcestershire, liquid smoke, water, and all seasonings) in a large bowl.
Add meat strips to marinade.
Refrigerate and marinate for 12 hours.
Remove meat from marinade and pat dry.
Arrange strips on oven racks or dehydrator trays.
Bake at 150°F (65°C) for 8 hours or until dried but still pliable.

notes: Very low temperature dries meat without cooking
Can also use a dehydrator
Store in airtight container

recipes.title: White Chocolate Snack Mix
recipes.description: Sweet and salty snack mix coated in white chocolate.

instructions.text: [UNCLEAR - instructions not visible on card. Likely: Melt white chocolate and coat cereal mixture, then spread to cool.]

notes: Instructions not visible on card - typical method is to melt white chocolate, mix with dry ingredients, spread on waxed paper to set

flags: Instructions not visible on original card

recipes.title: Chex Muddy Buddies
recipes.description: A sweet, chocolatey snack mix coated in powdered sugar - also known as 'Puppy Chow'.

ingredients.prep_note: Corn, Rice, Wheat, or Chocolate Chex or combination

instructions.text: Into large bowl, measure cereal; set aside.

In 1-quart microwavable bowl, microwave chocolate chips, peanut butter and butter uncovered on High 1 minute; stir. Microwave about 30 seconds longer or until mixture can be stirred smooth. Stir in vanilla.
Pour mixture over cereal, stirring until evenly coated. Pour into 2-gallon food-storage plastic bag.
Add powdered sugar. Seal bag; shake until well coated.
Spread on waxed paper to cool. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

notes: Also known as 'Puppy Chow'

recipes.title: Pretzels
recipes.description: Homemade soft pretzels.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in water.
Add sugar and flour to yeast mixture. Knead and cut into 4 pieces.
Roll into 12 inch worms and place on greased cookie sheet. Shape into pretzels.
Brush with beaten egg, and sprinkle with salt.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes.

assumptions: Inferred 1 for salt (standard quantity)
Based on 5/5 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Pizza Biscuit Wreath
recipes.description: Festive wreath-shaped appetizer made with biscuit dough stuffed with pepperoni and cheese, served with pizza sauce.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury Grands Jr. Golden Layers Buttermilk Biscuits

ingredients.prep_note: 1/2 inch; about 5 sticks at 3/4 oz each, cut crosswise into 4 pieces

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Spray large cookie sheet with cooking spray.
Separate 1 can of dough into 10 biscuits; keep second can refrigerated.
Press each biscuit into a 3-inch round. Place 3 pepperoni slices (or 6 mini pepperoni slices) and 1 piece of cheese on each dough round.
Wrap dough around filling, pinching edges to seal and form ball. Repeat with remaining can of dough, pepperoni, and cheese.
Leaving a 4-inch hole in center, arrange 8 balls, seam side down and sides almost touching, into ring on cookie sheet.
Arrange remaining 12 balls, sides almost touching, around outer edge of first ring.
Brush rings with beaten egg. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning.
Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Meanwhile, in small microwavable bowl, microwave pizza sauce, loosely covered, on high 45 to 60 seconds or until warm.
Carefully slide wreath from cookie sheet onto serving platter. Place bowl of pizza sauce in center of wreath. Garnish with fresh oregano if desired. Serve warm.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for Pillsbury Grands Jr. Golden Layers Buttermilk Biscuits
Based on 4/6 ingredients (67% coverage)

recipes.title: Cheesy Bacon Bombs
recipes.description: Deep-fried bacon-wrapped biscuit bites stuffed with gooey mozzarella cheese.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury Grands Flaky Layers Original Biscuits

instructions.text: Cube the cheese, and cut each biscuit into fourths.
Place one piece of cheese inside a biscuit quarter, and tightly roll it.
Wrap each rolled Bomb in a slice of bacon, and secure it with a skewer or toothpick.
In a medium-large pot, heat approximately 2 inches of oil to 350°F.
Fry the Bombs in small batches (maybe one or two at a time). The oil will expand, so stay close.
Drain Bombs on a paper towel. Serve warm.

notes: Oil will expand during frying - stay close and fry in small batches

missing_inputs: Not in database: Pillsbury Grands Flaky Layers Original Biscuits
Not in database: wooden skewers or toothpicks
assumptions: Inferred 2 for canola oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Fully-Loaded Mashed-Potato Pizza
recipes.description: Quick flatbread appetizer loaded with mashed potatoes, cheese, bacon, and sour cream.

ingredients.item: Flatout Rustic White Thin Crust Flatbread

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Place Flatout Flatbread on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for two minutes. Remove flatbread from oven.
Spread the mashed potatoes on the flatbread.
Evenly distribute the cheese and bacon on the potatoes.
Return flatbread to oven. Bake at 350°F for four minutes.
Remove from oven. Top with sour cream and chives.

assumptions: Based on 6/6 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Meatball Nacho Bites
recipes.description: Meatballs served in tortilla chip scoops with all the nacho fixings.

instructions.text: Cook meatballs in oven per package instructions.
Lay out tortilla chips on plate and fill with shredded lettuce.
Place a small tablespoon of salsa on bed of lettuce and add one meatball.
Top with a small dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Repeat for all meatballs.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Farm Rich Original Meatballs
assumptions: Based on 5/6 ingredients (83% coverage)

recipes.title: Mushroom Meatballs
recipes.description: Stuffed mushrooms with meatballs and beef gravy, topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Remove stems from mushrooms and place on a cookie sheet.
Place 1 Tbsp. of gravy and one frozen meatball in each mushroom cap.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Farm Rich Original Meatballs
assumptions: Based on 3/4 ingredients (75% coverage)

recipes.title: Jalapeño Pigs in a Blanket
recipes.description: Mini smokies wrapped in crescent rolls with spicy jalapeño cream cheese.

ingredients.item: Philadelphia Spicy Jalapeño Cream Cheese Spread

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F.
Unroll dough into 8 triangles; cut each triangle lengthwise into thirds.
Spread triangles evenly with cream cheese spread.
Top each with a Smokie; roll up.
Place, point-sides down, on baking sheet.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Oscar Mayer Mini Smokies
assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for Pillsbury Original Crescent Rolls
Based on 2/3 ingredients (67% coverage)

recipes.title: Smoky Bacon Ranch Dip
recipes.description: Creamy ranch dip with smoky chipotle peppers and crispy bacon.

ingredients.item: Hidden Valley Ranch Dip Seasoning Mix

instructions.text: Remove 2 chipotle peppers from the can and dice into 1/4" pieces.
In a mixing bowl blend the sour cream, ranch seasoning mix, and peppers together.
Cook the bacon until crispy, drain on paper towels.
Chop the bacon into small pieces and reserve a small amount for garnish.
Mix the chopped bacon into the sour cream mixture.
Eat immediately or place in fridge for a couple of hours to allow flavors to meld together.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated

missing_inputs: Not in database: Hidden Valley Ranch Dip Seasoning Mix
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for chives
Based on 4/5 ingredients (80% coverage)

recipes.title: Pepperoni Bites
recipes.description: Golden biscuits filled with saucy pizza filling - an easy appetizer.

instructions.text: For filling, in a bowl combine mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and pizza sauce. Set aside.
Separate biscuits. Flatten biscuits to 3-inch circles. Place about 1 rounded tablespoon filling in the center of each circle.
Bring edges of dough together. Pinch to seal. Place, seam side down, on greased baking sheets. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

notes: Easy recipe
Great party appetizer

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 9)

recipes.title: Crunchy Party Mix
recipes.description: Classic crispy snack mix with pretzels, cereals, and nuts.

ingredients.item: bite-size wheat or bran square cereal
bite-size rice or corn square cereal

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix margarine, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
In a large roasting pan mix pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle margarine mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat.
Bake in a 300° oven for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on foil to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Can freeze for up to four months
Oriental-Style: Omit Worcestershire and pretzels. Add 3 tbsp soy sauce and 2 tsp five-spice powder. Add chow mein noodles and fish crackers.
Italian-Style: Omit hot pepper sauce. Increase garlic to 1 tsp. Add 2 tsp Italian seasoning. Toss with Parmesan after baking.
Cajun-Style: Increase hot pepper sauce to 1 tbsp. Use pecan halves instead of mixed nuts.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 10)

recipes.title: Toasted Chili Nuts
recipes.description: Spicy roasted nuts with chili powder and Worcestershire sauce.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine margarine, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion salt, and red pepper. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
Spread nuts in a 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Toss with margarine mixture.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till toasted, stirring occasionally.
Spread on foil; cool. Store in an airtight container.

notes: FAST recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 10)

recipes.title: Nachos
recipes.description: Seven-layer spicy snack with meat, beans, and melted cheese.

ingredients.item: bulk pork sausage or ground beef

instructions.text: Cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in beans.
Arrange half of the chips on each of two 12-inch ovenproof platters.
Layer half of the meat-bean mixture, olives, chili peppers, and cheese on each platter.
Bake in a 350° oven for 5 to 7 minutes or till cheese melts.
Serve with avocado dip, dairy sour cream, and salsa, if desired.

notes: Microwave option: cook meat, onion, garlic in 2-quart casserole on high 3-5 minutes. Assemble and microwave on high 2-3 minutes.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 10)

recipes.title: Italian-Style Popcorn
recipes.description: Great to munch in front of the TV - seasoned popcorn with Italian herbs and Parmesan.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook and stir margarine, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder till margarine melts.
Toss with popcorn, coating evenly. Toss with cheese.

notes: FAST recipe
Cajun-Style variation: Omit Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and Parmesan. Add 1 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp garlic salt, and 1/8 tsp each ground white, red, and black pepper to the margarine.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 11)

recipes.title: Potato Skins
recipes.description: Crispy baked potato skins topped with cheese, served with salsa and green onion.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Prick potatoes with a fork. Bake in a 425° oven for 40 to 50 minutes or till tender. Cut into quarters.
Scoop out the insides (reserve for another use), leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells.
Brush both sides of potato skins with margarine. Place, cut side up, on a large baking sheet.
Bake in a 425° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till crisp. Sprinkle with cheese and, if desired, salt.
Bake about 2 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serve with salsa and green onion.

notes: Make potato shells ahead, then bake or fry just before serving
Fried variation: Omit margarine, don't bake second time. Deep fry shells at 375° for 1-2 minutes till golden. Drain, add cheese, bake 2 minutes.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 11)

recipes.title: Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: Delectable morsels filled with cheddar or blue cheese.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or crumbled blue cheese

instructions.text: Wash and drain mushrooms. Remove stems. Reserve caps. Chop enough stems to make 1 cup.
In a medium saucepan cook stems, onion, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender.
Stir in bread crumbs and cheese. Spoon crumb mixture into mushroom caps.
Arrange mushrooms in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 425° oven 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through.

notes: Spinach-Stuffed: Add 1 cup chopped fresh spinach, 1/4 cup Parmesan, 1/2 tsp marjoram
Sausage-Stuffed: Omit butter/cheese. Use 2 tbsp crumbs. Cook 1/2 lb Italian sausage with stems. Add 2 tbsp Parmesan.
Pepperoni-Stuffed: Omit cheese. Add 1/4 cup chopped pepperoni, 1/2 tsp Italian seasoning
Ham-Stuffed: Use corn bread stuffing mix, omit cheese. Add 1/4 cup ham, 2 tbsp pecans

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 11)

recipes.title: Creamy Dill Dip
recipes.description: Serve with carrot sticks, broccoli, cauliflower floweters, and mushrooms.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sour cream, onion, dillweed, and seasoned salt with an electric mixer till fluffy.
Chill up to 24 hours. If dip thickens after chilling, stir in 1 or 2 tablespoons milk.
Serve with vegetable dippers, crackers, or chips.

notes: Creamy Onion Dip: Omit onion, dillweed, salt. Add 2 tbsp regular onion soup mix.
Creamy Blue Cheese Dip: Omit dillweed and salt. Add 1/2 cup crumbled blue cheese and 1/3 cup chopped walnuts.
Creamy Seafood Dip: Add one 6 1/2-oz can minced clams or crabmeat, drained.
Creamy Tarragon Dip: Omit dillweed and salt. Add 1/2 cup watercress, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp anchovy paste, 1/2 tsp crushed dried tarragon.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 12)

recipes.title: Sour Cream Fruit Dip
recipes.description: To keep the fruit looking just-picked, brush it with lemon juice.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Stir together sour cream, preserves (cut up large pieces of fruit), and cinnamon.
Chill up to 24 hours. Serve with fruit.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 12)

recipes.title: Chili con Queso
recipes.description: Classic Tex-Mex cheese dip with tomatoes and green chiles.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender.
Stir in tomatoes and peppers. Simmer, uncovered, 10 minutes.
Toss cheeses with cornstarch. Gradually add to saucepan, stirring till melted.
Stir in hot sauce. Heat through. Serve with chips.

notes: Microwave option available

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 12)

recipes.title: Hot Cheese Dip
recipes.description: Warm cheese dip made with beer and tarragon.

ingredients.item: French bread cubes or tortilla chips

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, garlic, and tarragon in margarine.
Stir in cornstarch. Add beer all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Gradually add cheeses, stirring till melted.
Serve with bread or chips.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 12)

recipes.title: Guacamole
recipes.description: Fiery chili peppers and creamy, cool avocados pair up in this Mexican favorite.

ingredients.prep_note: drained, or use several dashes hot pepper sauce

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine avocados, onion, chili peppers or hot pepper sauce, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, and salt.
Cover and blend or process till mixture is smooth, scraping sides as necessary.
Stir in tomato, if desired. Transfer to a serving bowl.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Serve with chips.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 13)

recipes.title: Cheese and Pesto Spread
recipes.description: Elegant layered cheese spread with homemade pesto.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and Brie cheese.

For pesto, in a blender container combine basil, parsley, Parmesan cheese, nuts, garlic, and 2 tablespoons oil. Cover; blend with on-off turns till a paste forms. Gradually add remaining oil, blending on low speed till smooth.
Beat cream cheese and Brie together till nearly smooth. Beat whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture.
Line a 3 1/2- or 4-cup mold with plastic wrap. Spread one-fourth of cheese mixture into mold. Top with one-third of pesto. Repeat layers twice. Top with cheese mixture.
Chill 6 to 24 hours. To serve, unmold on plate. Remove plastic wrap. Garnish with fresh basil, if desired. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 13)

recipes.title: Cheddar Cheese Ball
recipes.description: Skip last-minute hassle by making this appetizer ahead and freezing it.

instructions.text: Bring cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and margarine to room temperature. Add milk, onion, pimiento, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce.
Beat till combined. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape mixture into a ball. Roll in parsley or nuts. Let stand 15 minutes.
Garnish with pimiento strips, if desired. Serve with crackers.

notes: Blue Cheese Ball: Omit pimiento and parsley. Add 1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese. Roll in chopped toasted almonds.
Deviled-Ham-and-Cheese Ball: Substitute Swiss cheese for cheddar and omit Worcestershire. Add one 3-oz can deviled ham.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 14)

recipes.title: Feta Cheese Ball
recipes.description: Mediterranean-style cheese ball with feta and olives.

instructions.text: Bring cheeses and margarine to room temperature. Beat till combined.
Stir in olives and onion. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape into a ball. Roll in parsley or almonds. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 14)

recipes.title: Eight-Layer Spread
recipes.description: For variety, add a ninth layer of alfalfa sprouts.

ingredients.item: shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese

instructions.text: Stir together beans and picante or taco sauce.
Arrange lettuce on a 12-inch platter, leaving a 2-inch open rim at edge of platter.
Spread bean mixture over lettuce, making a layer about 1/4 inch thick.
Then layer sour cream and avocado dip. Top with cheese, onion, and olives.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Before serving, arrange tomatoes on top. Arrange chips on platter around spread.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 14)

recipes.title: Cream-Cheese-Stuffed Slices
recipes.description: French bread stuffed with herbed cream cheese, sliced for serving.

instructions.text: Trim ends from rolls. Carefully scoop out centers, leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells. Reserve centers for another use.
In a bowl combine cream cheese, sour cream, onion or chives, pimiento, parsley, and seasoned salt. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed till smooth.
Stuff bread shells with cheese mixture, pressing firmly to prevent air pockets.
Wrap in foil or plastic wrap. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, cut rolls into 1/2-inch slices.

notes: Bacon-Stuffed Slices: Omit pimiento and seasoned salt. Stir 4 slices crumbled, cooked bacon into the cream cheese mixture.

assumptions: Based on 6/7 ingredients (86% coverage)

recipes.title: Shrimp-Cucumber Spread
recipes.description: Creamy shrimp spread with fresh cucumber and a hint of catsup.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl stir together cream cheese, mayonnaise or salad dressing, catsup, mustard, and garlic powder.
Stir in shrimp, cucumber, and onion.
Spread mixture over melba toast or crackers.

notes: Cut bread into decorative shapes with small cookie cutters if desired

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 15)

recipes.title: Nutty Cheese Spread
recipes.description: Stuff some celery sticks with this creamy spread and add them to a relish tray.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl bring cream cheese and Swiss or cheddar cheese to room temperature.
Add walnuts, milk, parsley, and onion powder. Stir till combined.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours.
To serve, spread on celery sticks, apple slices, crackers, or melba toast rounds.

notes: Brush apple slices with lemon juice to prevent browning

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 15)

recipes.title: Curried Chicken Spread
recipes.description: Curry powder and sour cream turn ordinary chicken salad into a tasty topping for party bread.

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, sour cream, green onion, nuts, curry powder, and salt.
Stir in chicken.
Spread chicken mixture over bread (or chill up to 24 hours before spreading). Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 15)

recipes.title: Avocado Pita Wedges
recipes.description: Avocado and mozzarella cheese make a great team in these minisandwiches.

ingredients.item: small whole wheat or white pita bread rounds

instructions.text: Cut each pita bread round into quarters. Spread the inside of each with mayonnaise.
Peel and seed avocado. Cut half of the avocado into 6 slices. (Reserve remaining avocado for another use.) Cut each slice in half crosswise.
Toss together cheese, tomato, and carrot. Spoon into each pita quarter.
Place an avocado piece in each. Top with alfalfa sprouts. Secure with toothpicks, if necessary.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 15)

recipes.title: Cocktail Meatballs
recipes.description: Party meatballs with choice of three sauces: Tangy Cranberry, Dill, or Polynesian.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, parsley, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add beef. Mix well.
Shape into 1-inch meatballs. Place in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till done. Drain.
Meanwhile, prepare Tangy Cranberry Sauce, Dill Sauce, or Polynesian Sauce. Add meatballs; heat through.

notes: Tangy Cranberry Sauce: Combine 8-oz can jellied cranberry sauce, 2 tbsp steak sauce, 1 tbsp brown sugar. Heat.
Dill Sauce: Melt 2 tbsp butter, stir in 2 tbsp flour, 1 tsp beef bouillon, dash nutmeg, dash pepper. Add 3/4 cup water. Thicken. Add 3/4 cup light cream and 1 tsp dried dillweed.

Polynesian Sauce: Drain 15 1/4-oz can pineapple chunks (save juice + water to make 1 cup). Combine with 2 tbsp catsup, 2 tbsp vinegar, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 tsp beef bouillon, dash red pepper. Thicken. Add pineapple and 1 sliced pepper.

assumptions: Inferred 1 for pepper (standard quantity)
Based on 8/8 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Franks
recipes.description: Cocktail franks in a tangy maple and citrus sauce with pearl onions.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine syrup, juice, vinegar, cornstarch, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in frankfurters and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes or till onions are tender.

notes: Microwave option available

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 16)

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Provide lots of napkins with these saucy wings.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut off and discard wing tips. Cut each wing at joint to make 2 sections.
Place the wing pieces in a single layer in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 20 minutes. Drain fat from baking pan.
For sauce, combine remaining ingredients. Brush wings with sauce. Bake 10 minutes.
Turn wings over; brush again with sauce. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or till chicken is tender.

notes: Microwave option available

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 17)

recipes.title: Rumaki
recipes.description: If you like chicken livers, you'll love these classic bacon-wrapped appetizers.

instructions.text: Combine wine, soy sauce, oil, sugar, garlic powder, ginger, and 1/4 cup water. Stir in livers and water chestnuts. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours.
Cook bacon slightly. Drain. Drain livers and water chestnuts.
Wrap a bacon piece around a liver half and a water chestnut slice. Secure with a wooden toothpick.
Broil 4 inches from heat for 6 to 8 minutes or till livers are no longer pink; turn once. Serve warm.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 17)

recipes.title: Cheese Twists
recipes.description: These pastry snacks go great alone or with salads.

ingredients.item: toasted sesame seed or poppy seed

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine flour, garlic powder, salt, and, if desired, red pepper. Cut in cheese and margarine or butter till pieces are the size of small peas.
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the water over part of the mixture. Gently toss with a fork. Push to side of bowl. Repeat till all of flour mixture is moistened. Shape dough into a ball.
On a lightly floured surface, flatten dough with hands. Roll out dough from center to edges, forming a 10-inch square.
Brush with egg. Sprinkle with sesame seed or poppy seed. Cut dough into 5x1/2-inch strips. Twist each strip.
Place on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till golden brown. Serve warm or cool.

notes: Herbed Parmesan Twists: Omit red pepper. Add 1/4 tsp crushed dried oregano. Substitute Parmesan cheese for sesame seed.
Swiss-Caraway Twists: Substitute Swiss cheese for cheddar and caraway seed for sesame seed.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 7)

recipes.title: Pastry-Wrapped Olives
recipes.description: Easy cheese pastry wrapped around olives for a simple appetizer.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 1 stick piecrust mix, 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese, and a dash ground red pepper. Prepare piecrust dough according to package directions.
Pat 30 pitted ripe or pimiento-stuffed olives dry with paper towels.
Shape about 1 teaspoon of the dough around each olive. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 17)

recipes.title: Egg Rolls
recipes.description: These crisp, golden egg rolls make a delicious start to any meal.

ingredients.prep_note: crab, pork & shrimp, ham-orange, or vegetable

instructions.text: For each egg roll, place one egg roll skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the desired filling just below the center of egg roll skin.
Fold the corner nearest you over the filling, tucking the corner under the filling. Fold side corners over top, like an envelope. Roll up toward the remaining corner.
Moisten the point with water and press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 365°.
Fry the egg rolls, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

missing_inputs: Not in database: filling of choice
assumptions: Based on 2/3 ingredients (67% coverage)

recipes.title: Wontons
recipes.description: Every bit as tasty as egg rolls, wontons are smaller and more manageable at appetizer parties.

ingredients.prep_note: crab, pork & shrimp, ham-orange, or vegetable

instructions.text: For each wonton, place one wonton skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon a rounded teaspoon of desired filling just below the center of wonton skin.
Fold the corner closest to you over the filling and tuck it under the filling. Roll up, leaving 1 inch unrolled at the top.
Moisten the right corner with water. Grasp right and left corners and bring them over the filling, lapping the right corner over the left corner. Press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 365°.
Fry the wontons, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

missing_inputs: Not in database: filling of choice
assumptions: Based on 1/3 ingredients (33% coverage)

recipes.title: Crab Filling (for Egg Rolls or Wontons)
recipes.description: Use this filling for egg rolls or wontons.

instructions.text: In a skillet cook cabbage, pea pods, water chestnuts, onion, and garlic in oil for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove from heat.
In a mixing bowl combine crabmeat, soy sauce, dry sherry, pepper, and the cooked vegetable mixture. Toss to mix.

assumptions: Based on 9/10 ingredients (90% coverage)

recipes.title: Pork and Shrimp Filling (for Egg Rolls or Wontons)
recipes.description: Classic Asian-style filling with pork and shrimp.

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp. Cut up shrimp.
In a mixing bowl combine shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, mushrooms, green onion, soy sauce, and gingerroot. Mix well.

assumptions: Based on 6/7 ingredients (86% coverage)

recipes.title: Ham-Orange Filling (for Egg Rolls or Wontons)
recipes.description: A unique filling with ham and citrus flavors.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine ham, bamboo shoots, onion, broccoli, orange peel, orange juice, and red pepper. Mix well.

assumptions: Based on 7/7 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Vegetable Filling (for Egg Rolls or Wontons)
recipes.description: Vegetarian filling option for egg rolls or wontons.

instructions.text: In a steamer basket over boiling water place spinach, carrot, mushrooms, zucchini, and onion. Cover; steam for 4 minutes. Drain well.
Transfer to a mixing bowl. Stir in soy sauce, dry mustard, pepper, and garlic powder.

assumptions: Based on 9/9 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Spinach Phyllo Triangles
recipes.description: Greek-style spanakopita triangles with spinach and feta cheese.

instructions.text: For filling, cook spinach, onion, and garlic according to spinach package directions. Drain well in colander. Press the back of a spoon against mixture to force out excess moisture.
Combine spinach mixture, feta cheese, and oregano.

Lightly brush 1 sheet of phyllo with some of the melted margarine or butter. Place another phyllo sheet on top; brush with some margarine. Repeat with a third sheet of phyllo and margarine. (Cover the remaining phyllo with a damp cloth to prevent drying.)
Cut the stack of phyllo lengthwise into 6 strips. For each triangle, spoon about 1 tablespoon of the filling about 1 inch from one end of each strip.
Fold the end over the filling at a 45-degree angle. Continue folding to form a triangle that encloses filling. Repeat with remaining phyllo, margarine or butter, and filling.
Place triangles on a baking sheet. Brush with margarine. Bake in a 375° oven for 18 to 20 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 19)

recipes.title: Oysters Rockefeller
recipes.description: Classic baked oysters with spinach topping.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook spinach and onion in a small amount of boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes or till tender. Drain; press out excess moisture.
Thoroughly wash oysters. Open shells with an oyster knife or other blunt-tipped knife. Remove oysters and dry. Discard flat top shells; wash deep bottom shells. Place each oyster in a shell.
Combine spinach mixture, 2 tablespoons of margarine, parsley, garlic, hot sauce, and dash pepper. Spoon 1 teaspoon atop each oyster.
Toss together crumbs and remaining margarine. Sprinkle over spinach-topped oysters.
Line a shallow baking pan with rock salt to about 1/2-inch depth. (Or, use crumpled foil to keep shells from tipping.) Arrange oysters atop.
Bake in a 425° oven 10 to 12 minutes or till edges of oysters begin to curl.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 20)

recipes.title: Shrimp Cocktail
recipes.description: Classic appetizer with chilled shrimp and cocktail sauce.

instructions.text: Arrange shrimp in six lettuce-lined cocktail cups or glasses.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the Cocktail Sauce over each. Serve with lemon.

notes: Fruit Shrimp Cocktail: Add 1 sectioned orange, 1 sectioned grapefruit, and 1 seeded, peeled, sliced avocado.
Crab Cocktail: Substitute two 6-oz packages frozen crabmeat, thawed, and 2 cups finely chopped celery for the shrimp.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 20)

recipes.title: Salmon Mousse
recipes.description: Elegant chilled salmon mousse served with crackers.

instructions.text: Drain salmon, reserving liquid. Add water to liquid to make 1/2 cup. In saucepan sprinkle gelatin over reserved liquid. Let stand 5 minutes. Heat and stir till gelatin dissolves. Remove from heat.
Mix mayonnaise, chili sauce, and lemon juice. Stir into gelatin. Chill till partially set (consistency of unbeaten egg whites).
Fold in salmon, eggs, celery, onion, chives, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Beat cream till soft peaks form. Fold into gelatin mixture.
Pour into a 3 1/2- or 4-cup mold. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
Unmold on lettuce-lined serving platter. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 20)

recipes.title: Codfish Balls
recipes.description: Traditional New England-style fried cod and potato balls.

instructions.text: Soak cod in water to cover for 4 to 24 hours; change water often. Drain; cut into small pieces.
Cook cod, potatoes, and onion in boiling water about 10 minutes or till tender; drain.
Beat mixture till combined. Beat in egg, cheese, parsley, margarine, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 375°.
Drop cod mixture by heaping tablespoons, a few at a time, into hot fat. Fry about 2 minutes or till golden.
Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar or cocktail sauce, if desired.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 20)

recipes.title: Batter-Fried Vegetables
recipes.description: Bottled buttermilk salad dressing or sweet-and-sour sauce also make flavorful dipping sauces.

ingredients.item: ice water, cold milk, or cold beer

ingredients.prep_note: mushrooms, cauliflower, broccoli, peppers, onion rings, green beans, asparagus, sweet potato, eggplant

instructions.text: For batter, in a medium mixing bowl stir together egg and ice water, milk, or beer. Add flour all at once. Beat with a rotary beater or wire whisk till mixture is smooth. Set aside.
Rinse vegetables under cold water; drain. Pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°.
Dip vegetables, a few at a time, into the batter, swirling to coat. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till light golden brown.
Drain vegetables on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven. Repeat with remaining vegetables.
Serve with individual bowls of Dipping Sauce.

notes: Dipping Sauce: Combine 1 cup water, 1/4 cup dry sherry, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1 tsp grated gingerroot. Heat to boiling. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 21)

recipes.title: Fried Cheese
recipes.description: Seasoned crumbs keep the melted cheese inside.

instructions.text: Cut the cheese into 2 1/2 x 1/2 x 1/2-inch sticks.
Combine crumbs and fines herbes. Dip cheese sticks into egg, then roll in crumb mixture, coating evenly. Dip cheese into egg and crumbs again. (Be sure cheese is completely coated with crumbs.)
Chill 2 to 4 hours to set the coating.
In a heavy saucepan or a deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°.
Fry the cheese sticks, a few at a time, for 30 to 45 seconds or till golden. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with taco sauce, if desired.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 21)

recipes.title: Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes
recipes.description: The refreshing herb-cheese filling brings out the best in these tiny tomatoes.

instructions.text: Slice a thin layer off top of each tomato. Using a small spoon, carefully scoop out and discard pulp. Invert tomatoes; drain on paper towels.
For filling, in a small bowl combine cream cheese, chives, milk, basil, pepper, and garlic powder. Beat till smooth.
Spoon or pipe the filling into tomatoes. Serve immediately or chill up to 8 hours.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 21)

recipes.title: Chicken Liver Pâté
recipes.description: Smooth and savory chicken liver spread for crackers.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons of drippings. Drain and crumble bacon; set aside.
Add chicken livers, onion, and garlic to reserved drippings. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes or till livers are no longer pink. Cool slightly.

In a blender container or food processor bowl place 2 tablespoons milk, salt, nutmeg or allspice, pepper, chicken liver mixture, and bacon. Cover and blend or process till well combined. (Add 1 tablespoon milk if mixture appears stiff.)
Line a 1 1/2-cup mold or small bowl with plastic wrap. Spoon mixture into mold. Cover; chill 3 to 24 hours.
To serve, unmold and remove wrap. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 22)

recipes.title: Marinated Cheese And Olives
recipes.description: The cheese takes on a trio of Mediterranean flavors: lemon, garlic, and fennel.

ingredients.item: cheddar, Colby, Edam, Gouda, or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Cut cheese and pepperoni or salami into 1/2-inch pieces.
In a bowl combine oil, lemon juice, garlic, fennel seed, and pepper.
Stir in cheese, pepperoni or salami, and olives. Cover and chill up to 3 days, stirring occasionally.
Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Serve with toothpicks.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 22)

recipes.title: Lemon and Herb Mushrooms
recipes.description: Oregano and thyme add zest to these tangy mouthfuls.

instructions.text: Halve any large mushrooms. In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms in boiling water 1 minute. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
For marinade, in a small saucepan combine lemon juice, salad oil, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and thyme. Cook till boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
In a medium mixing bowl combine drained mushrooms, hot marinade, and sliced onion.
Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

notes: Microwave directions available

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 22)

recipes.title: Melon and Prosciutto
recipes.description: Spicy prosciutto, a thinly sliced Italian ham, meshes perfectly with cool crisp melon.

ingredients.item: very thinly sliced prosciutto or fully cooked ham

instructions.text: Cut cantaloupe or honeydew melon in half and remove seeds. Use a melon baller to scoop out pulp, or cut pulp into bite-size cubes.
Cut prosciutto or ham into 1-inch-wide strips.
Wrap one strip of prosciutto or ham around each melon ball. Fasten with a toothpick.

notes: EASY recipe

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 22)

recipes.title: Caramel Corn
recipes.description: This sweet snack is oven-baked for extra crunch.

ingredients.prep_note: about ⅓ to ½ cup unpopped

instructions.text: Remove all unpopped kernels from popped corn. Place popcorn in a greased 17x12x2-inch baking pan. Keep popcorn warm in a 300° oven while making caramel mixture.
Butter the sides of a heavy 1½-quart saucepan. In saucepan combine brown sugar, margarine or butter, and corn syrup. Cook and stir over medium heat to boiling. Clip candy thermometer to side of pan.
Cook and stir over medium heat to 255°, hard-ball stage (about 4 minutes).
Remove saucepan from heat. Stir in baking soda and vanilla; pour over popcorn. Stir gently to coat.
Bake in a 300° oven for 15 minutes; stir. Bake 5 minutes more.
Transfer popcorn mixture to a large piece of foil; cool completely. Break into clusters. Store tightly covered.

notes: Nutty Caramel Corn: Prepare as above, except add 1½ cups peanuts, walnut halves, cashews, or pecan halves to caramel-coated corn before baking. Toss gently. Makes about 10½ cups (10 servings).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Oven-baked caramel corn for a crispy, sweet snack.

instructions.text: Pop the popcorn. Place in lightly greased sink or large bowl.
Combine sugar, butter (or margarine), cream of tartar, and syrup in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, add soda. Pour and mix quickly over popcorn.
Place immediately the popcorn mixture into lightly greased pan(s) or onto lightly greased cookie sheet(s).
Set in prewarmed oven at 200° for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: People Chow
recipes.description: Addictive chocolate-peanut butter coated cereal snack also known as Muddy Buddies.

instructions.text: In large bowl with lid, pour in Rice Chex.
Melt chips, butter, and peanut butter. Pour melted mixture over Rice Chex.
Mix carefully so you don't break Rice Chex.
Pour in powdered sugar. Cover container with lid and shake until coated.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories
Based on 5/5 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs
recipes.description: Four different flavors to choose from.

instructions.text: Halve hard-cooked eggs lengthwise and remove yolks. Place yolks in a bowl; mash with a fork.
Add mayonnaise, mustard, and vinegar; mix well. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.
Stuff egg white halves with yolk mixture. Garnish with paprika or parsley, if desired.

notes: Italian-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mayonnaise, mustard, and vinegar. Add 1/4 cup creamy Italian salad dressing and 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese to mashed yolks; mix well.
Indian-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mustard and vinegar. Add 1/4 cup finely chopped peanuts and 1/2 teaspoon curry powder to yolk mixture; mix well.

Mexican-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mustard and vinegar. Add 2 tablespoons canned diced green chili peppers, 1 tablespoon chopped pitted ripe olives, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, and 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper to yolk mixture; mix well. Garnish with sliced pitted ripe olives or cilantro and serve with salsa, if desired.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese
cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables

instructions.text: Bring shredded cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside.
Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper.
Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Fondue
recipes.description: If you don't have a fondue pot, just serve this creamy fondue from a casserole dish.

ingredients.item: dry white wine or apple juice
dippers (breadsticks, cubed French bread, fruit wedges, or vegetables)

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan heat wine or juice just till bubbling. Add American cheese and mustard, stirring till smooth and bubbly.
Stir in cream cheese; cook and stir over low heat till smooth.
Transfer mixture to a fondue pot. If desired, keep cheese mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with dippers.

notes: Microwave directions: In 1-quart casserole mix 1/2 cup wine or juice, American cheese, mustard, and cream cheese. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 4 to 5 minutes or till melted and bubbly; stir every minute. Serve as above.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Garbanzo Sandwich Spread
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162
recipes.description: Serve this spread for lunch in pita bread or on bagels, or as appetizer on party rye bread.

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine beans, tahini, juice, oil, garlic, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cover; blend or process till smooth, scraping sides as necessary. Transfer to a bowl.
Stir in parsley and pimiento. Cover; chill 2 to 24 hours.

notes: Mediterranean Sandwich Spread: Spread about 1/3 cup cold Garbanzo Sandwich Spread on 1 slice whole wheat bread. Top with 2 tomato slices, 1 slice Swiss or brick cheese, and another slice bread. Makes 1 serving.
Tahini Substitute: Stir together 3 tablespoons creamy peanut butter and 1 tablespoon sesame oil till well combined. Makes 1/4 cup.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

instructions.text: Pop the popcorn. Place in lightly greased sink or large bowl. Combine sugar, butter (or margarine), cream of tartar, and syrup in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat, add soda. Pour and mix quickly over popcorn.

Place immediately the popcorn mixture into lightly greased pan(s) or onto lightly greased cookie sheet(s). Set in prewarmed oven at 200° for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

ingredients.item: chocolate or butterscotch chips (or 1/2 cup each)

instructions.text: In large bowl with lid, pour in Rice Chex. Melt chips, butter, and peanut butter. Pour melted mixture over Rice Chex. Mix carefully so you don't break Rice Chex. Pour in powdered sugar. Cover container with lid and shake until coated.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories
Based on 5/5 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Caramel Corn
recipes.description: Homemade caramel corn - crunchy and sweet.

instructions.text: Pop corn and place in large roasting pan. Add nuts if using.
In saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, water, and cream of tartar.
Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 5 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda (mixture will foam).
Pour over popcorn, stirring to coat evenly.
Bake at 250°F, stirring every 15 minutes, for about 1 hour.
Spread on wax paper to cool. Break apart when cooled.

notes: Store in airtight container. Like brittle when done right.

assumptions: popped popcorn: used default unit
water: used default unit

recipes.title: Chex Party Mix
recipes.description: Classic savory snack mix with Chex cereals, nuts, pretzels, and seasonings.

instructions.text: In large microwavable bowl, mix cereals, nuts, pretzels and bagel chips; set aside.
In small microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. Stir in seasonings.
Pour over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated.
Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool.
Store in airtight container.
Oven Prep: Pre-heat oven to 250°F. Put cereal and seasoning mixture into ungreased roasting pan and bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes.

notes: Can be made in microwave or oven

assumptions: Calculated for 24 servings

recipes.title: Lebanese Seven Spices
recipes.description: A classic Lebanese spice blend with black pepper, cumin, paprika, coriander, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, and cardamom.

instructions.text: Making this amazing spice is quite easy so let's begin by grabbing a container for storage.
Put the following ingredients into the container: cardamom, black pepper, cinnamon, cumin, nutmeg, paprika, clove, and coriander.
Make sure to mix the spices together nicely.
Cover the container with a good lid so no air can penetrate.
Store and enjoy.

recipes.title: Lebanese Lemon Salad Dressing
recipes.description: A simple and tangy Lebanese dressing with fresh lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and salt.

instructions.text: This is a very simple, but tasty dressing so let's get started by grabbing a nice sized container for storage (preferably a bowl).
Now combine your items: pepper, juiced lemon, salt, olive oil, and garlic.
Take care to mix everything nicely.
Serve immediately as dressing for all types of salads.
Enjoy.

assumptions: Calculated for 1 servings
